DESCRIPTION

Job summary
Work hard, have fun and make history with AWS Public Policy, Economic Development team. Every year, AWS invests billions of dollars around the world in the newest cloud computing tools, data center infrastructure, and education for cloud-skilled professions. These investments create jobs and support local businesses. Cloud technology helps businesses and governments reduce computing costs, improve productivity and accelerate innovation.

This role will lead a portfolio of public facing research reports studying the economic impact of AWS investments among countries in the Asia-Pacific region. This research has a potential to produce strong business impact across APAC countries: it will be used by teams in AWS Public Policy and AWS Public Relations to communicate economic benefits of AWS investments to government officials, AWS customers and public. This role is for a someone who is resourceful and analytical, who can operate independently in a complex and changing environment, and who enjoys creative thinking and crafting narratives using diverse economic data.

The ideal candidate would have a strong background in one of the following fields: macroeconomics, international trade, labor economics. A proven track record of independently driving research projects and delivering insightful economics research results is strongly preferred. In addition to economic research skills, success in this role also requires strong project management skills and the ability to coordinate across many internal AWS teams (Public Policy, Public Relations, Finance, Sales, etc.), as well as third party (economic consulting companies, academics).

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

. Master's degree or higher in economics, public policy or related field
. 5+ years of experience with research and analysis in government, consulting, non-profit organizations, or similar.
. Experience in leading research projects and client communication.
. Experience of working with data using Excel, State or other data analytics software
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

. Excellent communication skills, ability to communicate economic concepts clearly to non-economists.
. Proven track record in telling impactful economic stories with data.
. Previous economic or development policy research or business consultant/analyst experience, with a focus on understanding the intersection of business and public policy in the technology space.
. Resourcefulness and strong research and analytical skills, including the ability to find new sources of information (e.g., data points) to support policy positions.
. Self-starter with proven track record of successfully working with a wide array of functional groups across organizations and culture.
. Experience owning program strategy, overseeing end-to-end delivery, and communicating results to senior leadership.
. Project management experience including the strong ability to break down tasks, simplify roadmaps, establish owners and timelines, and status reporting.
. Experience using data and metrics, and leveraging tools and software, to drive improvements in processes.
. Ability to maintain highest personal levels of ethical conduct, confidentiality, and integrity.
. Ability to navigate ambiguous environments.

DESCRIPTION

Do you have a passion to install, deploy, service and maintain mission critical IT infrastructure in one of the world's largest and fastest-growing cloud data centers

Are you looking to expand your horizon in an exciting and dynamic work environment that encourages creativity and boundless opportunities for career development

Do you enjoy solving problems and delivering value-adding results

If you answered yes to any of these questions, then Amazon Web Services Data Center is the place to be!

This role is a unique opportunity to work in some of the most cutting edge data centers in the world. Amazon data centers are large-scale high-density centers where you will be working on changing the face of Cloud technology in the region.

You will be assigned as a trainee where you will have exposure to learn and understand how our Data Center works, interact with our support teams and customers. Experience the latest technologies of our cloud that puts you among top talents of data center technical support teams. You will spend 6 months on the trainee program, followed by a 3-month probation period. By the end of the probation, your progression will then be evaluated if you are ready to be a full time Amazonian.

Responsibilities
There is never a dull moment as each day presents itself with different challenges. Some of the key responsibilities you will be trained on are:
. Perform Data Center Servers and Network systems installation and configurations
. Perform hardware diagnostics and troubleshoot all Systems hardware and Network related problems
. Perform intermediate level Linux OS troubleshooting and network configuration troubleshooting
. Perform replacement of internal and external hardware parts of Servers and Network devices
. Perform storage media (HDD, SSD etc.) sanitization and destruction tasks
. Maintain a high level of system reliability by prioritizing resolution of trouble tickets efficiently
. Work with multiple internal teams (DC operations, DC Engineering, Logistics, Security, Projects etc.) and be a good team player
. Work with external/3rd party vendors and contractors to achieve organization needs
. Adhere to DC operations, Logistics, Security and Safety related processes and guidelines
. Practice and enforce Amazons Security and Safety best practices
. Share ideas and contribute in projects to improve DC work environment and to improve DC operational efficiencies
. Participate, lead and deliver small to mid-scale projects including Data Center rollout
. Understands operational metrics and drive actions to achieve the targets
This is an opportunity where the candidate will work with local and/or global Data center teams as needed.

As a Data Center Technician Trainee, he/she will be working with Site stationed DCO, DCEO, Logistics and Security team to support small and Large scale projects and support activities like DC Audits (Rack, Server, parts etc), cycle counts etc. He/She also will be working on Software development projects for Singapore Infrastructure teams.

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

. Electrical & Electronics, Computer & Communications Engineering, Information & Digital Technologies diploma or certification holder, recent graduate or expected to graduate in 2022
. Passionate about IT infrastructure and hardware
. Basic knowledge of system hardware and network concepts & devices
. Having troubleshooting experience is a plus
. Good written & verbal communication and team player skills
. Basic knowledge of data centers and cloud computing technologies and services
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

. Familiar with Linux operating system
. Experience of server operation system level development, familiar with server hardware components and basic troubleshooting
. Experience of networking setup and configuration
. Knowledge of programming language i.e. Python, Perl, Shell Scripting is a plus but not a must
Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer, and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or other legally protected status.

DESCRIPTION

Do you have a knack for analyzing business deals and developing commercial terms that represent a win-win outcome for all parties Can you distill complex scenarios and simplify them to the essentials, and craft elegant terms that are easy to understand and apply Have you managed APJ based teams Have you developed teams Do you love to analyze data, and drive simplification and strategic initiatives Are you great at collaborating with multiple functions and stakeholders to build alignment around approaches If the answer is yes to all, this might be the perfect role for you!

The Public Sector Business Desk under Amazon Web Services is seeking a senior individual for a Manager of Business Desk to support the Asian Pacific (APJ) public sector business. Partnering with Sales, you will manage/work with customers and internal teams (Legal, Finance, Capture/Bid, Operations, Service teams, and others) to structure, negotiate, and close deals. The ideal candidate will have customer facing experience and have an interest in digging into technology use cases, be a proven collaborator across multiple stakeholders, and significant experience in crafting non-standard deals with customer and internal sales teams.

You will have a background to model terms that reflect the best interests of the business and the customer (procurement to C-Level executives). The ideal candidate will also have technical depth (cloud, SaaS, software, and etc.) to help and guide customers procure cloud technologies and services. The ability to be influential and collaborate effectively across multiple organizations and teams is key. You must have high business judgment and a keen sense of ownership to deliver results. Executive presence and ability to present the complex in a clear and concise manner to the senior management team.

This role is based in Singapore.

A day in the life

About the hiring group

Job responsibilities

. Manage business desk team spread across the Asia pacific region.
. Serve as a player/coach of the APJ Public Sector team to negotiate and assist in closing deals, and increase deal velocity.
. Develop best practices through analysis and reporting in support of continuous improvement.
. Working directly with customers, field teams, leaders, services/support teams, and AWS leadership teams - provide leadership, identify customer blockers/enablers, and close issues.
. Understand the business and technical requirements of customers, and work closely with internal teams to craft appropriate deal terms and remove obstacles/friction.
. Assist with complex contract negotiations and manage internal deal review processes. Including collaborating with internal teams such as Legal, Finance, Partner, Capture, Proposal, Operations, Service teams, and etc.
. Support the Public Sector APJ business and other worldwide teams with custom pricing.
. Analyze trends, formulate projections, create financial models, evaluate alternatives, and provide recommendations to drive deal closure.
. Building new/improve existing data reporting and processes. Report on monthly, quarterly and annual pipeline metrics and business forecasts inclusive of Run Rate, Opportunity and Contractual elements.
. Facilitate alignment and effective AWS communication within sales team and internal/external key partners/customers and promptly resolve any conflict to encourage harmonious and productive interaction.
. Train and work closely with local field teams to ensure awareness of the program and related processes.
. Trusted advisor and thought leader in the development of deal structure. Partner with the execution of the sales cycle (strategy, structuring, negotiation, and closure) for strategic, complex, or highly competitive opportunities.
. Improve existing constructs, processes, and pricing programs.
. Provide management with deal insights/analytics, metrics-based reporting, and ad-hoc reporting

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

. BA/BS degree equivalent experience
. At least 5+ years of experience working as business desk/deal desk/licensing specialist/sales operations
. At least 2+ years of experience managing a team
. Fluency in English and other APJ languages
. Excellent writing skills in English
. Prior work experience in the technology industry
. Proficiency in Excel Modeling and working with reporting tools
. Strong analytical, communication, and presentation skills and the ability to articulate complex concepts to customers, partners, and internal cross-functional teams

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

. Advanced degree or relevant experience
. Knowledge of APJ public sector
. Experience with cloud computing or related field
. Familiar with sales productivity tools such as Salesforce.com and Content Management Solutions
. Adept in a fast-paced environment, and able to navigate multiple ongoing priorities and ambiguities
. Experience working with product or service team
. Successful track record of driving adoption of new and disruptive technologies

Job Description :
This role will work directly with AWS partners and financial institutions in adapting their control frameworks to successfully move their IT to the AWS cloud.

Amazon Web Services (AWS) is rapidly expanding its presence in the enterprise arena with a focus on financial services. AWS offers global public cloud offerings with a diversity of compliance programs and attestations to enable AWS customer base. AWS is looking for independent, passionate, and deeply experienced professionals in the global financial services compliance and governance arena to provide thought leadership in assisting financial institutions to move regulated workloads and data into the cloud by addressing their specific security, regulatory, compliance and governance requirements. This candidate should be an experienced and innovative security/compliance/governance professional who has the ability to handle a wide range of compliance requirements and can translate those requirements into applications for cloud computing. The Compliance Specialist will work directly with AWS partners and financial institutions in adapting their control frameworks to successfully move their IT to the AWS cloud.

This key position requires specialized experience supporting financial services sector compliance efforts and will have high visibility at the most senior levels of government agencies, institutions, and AWS including frequent interaction with CISOs, CTOs, CCOs, CROs, their staffs, and AWS senior leadership. The position, as part of the AWS Worldwide Financial Services team, will act as the primary Governance/Compliance interface for Financial Services institutions. The candidate will already have, and continue to foster, key relationships, and be able to interpret the impacts of policy changes, and track and report on industry trends.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:
. Participate in financial services regulatory compliance assessments and relevant control discussions with AWS teams. This includes synthesizing control requirements, and recommending and pursuing alternative approaches assisting customers in developing compliance roadmaps
. Develop industry leading compliance related, customer-facing resources based on projected customer needs and current demand
. Assist the AWS Security Assurance team in determining the strategic direction of the various AWS compliance programs based on customer interaction and demonstrative metrics
. Be and remain connected with industry trends and events. Develop and maintain relationships with key leaders in governance, risk, and compliance at Financial Services institutions
. Collaborate with service teams on industry specific requirements that impact components of AWS services
. Assist the work of Financial Services institutions internal and external auditors or advisors as needed
. Keep the AWS Worldwide Financial Services leadership team fully informed of customer engagement status, issues, and activities.

A day in the life

About the hiring group

Job responsibilities

Basic Qualifications :
. Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems Management, or other related business fields
. Progressive experience in Financial Services compliance, legal, or governance
. Personal, hands-on experience in developing compliance/regulatory documentation
. Experience in working directly with senior corporate/government officials and/or auditors
. Strong verbal and written communication skills are a must
. Must have a demonstrated ability to work effectively across internal and external organizations
. Proficiency in MS Word, Excel, and PowerPoint

Travel may be required for this role, up to 50%.

Preferred Qualifications :
. Familiarity with technical assessments and audit methodologies for technical systems (network, operating systems, application security) as well as IT auditing processes
. Familiarity with cloud computing services/deployment architecture
. Demonstration of innovative compliance approaches in non-traditional IT environments (cloud)
. Experience and proficiency in public speaking
. Deep understanding of relevant regulatory guidance Federal Risk and Authorization Management Program (FedRAMP), National Institute for Science and Technology (NIST) guidelines, Federal Information Processing Standards (FIPS), FCA guidance FG16/5 (Guidance for firms outsourcing to the cloud and other third party IT services), EBA Recommendations on Outsourcing to Cloud Providers, C5 requirements of the Federal Office of Information Security of Germany and other applicable standards and requirements
. Experience in building successful compliance programs
. Experience defining compliance roadmaps based on customer requirements, compliance documentation, and ensuring that committed assessments are delivered on schedule
. Have a record of delivery of onboarding compliance financial services workloads
. Intermediate or better level of knowledge of certification requirements of an Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS) under the aforementioned compliance programs
. Ability to think critically and be responsive to time sensitive requests

About The Company
Knowledgehut Singapore welcomes you not for how you look, where you come from, or differences you may have. We want you here for who you are. Diversity at the company helps us see a greater picture represented by different voices, contributing back to society. So, feel free to express who you are and be proud of your heritage and personal experience as you begin your journey with us!
The Knowledgehut Holding Company, located out of Bangalore, was established in 2011 to empower technologists and other professionals with high-quality, hands-on learning opportunities at scale, nurture talent for the future of work, and help close the skills gap. Leveraging a state-of-the-art immersive learning experience platform, KnowledgeHut fundamentally disrupts how tech is learnt and empowers enterprises with a scalable tech-driven solution to align role-based skill requirements with desired business outcomes. Whether you're looking to develop capabilities in Software Development, IT Service Management, Cyber Security, Cloud Computing, Machine Learning / AI or Data Science, KnowledgeHut is your learning partner of choice.
The uPGrad Education Company, a global online higher education provider with Temasek Holding (Singapore) investing US$120 million in them, acquired KnowledgeHut Group in August 2021. The company intends to use the capital proceeds to strengthen its team further, scale its global market operations, bolster its technology and product capabilities, and pursue merger and acquisition opportunities.
We will reach out to shortlisted candidates for further career conversations.

Cloud Kinetics is a Portfolio Company of I Squared Capital. I Squared Capital (ISQ) is a private equity firm focusing on global infrastructure investments.
We seeking a Cloud Support Engineer to join our growing team. This is a great role for someone who wants to build knowledge and experience on leading cloud computing technology such as Amazon Web Services and Google Computing Platform.
Responsibility
Responsible for day-to-day customer support and administration of cloud services

Provide advice and information to customers regarding general cloud infrastructure as service offerings and best practices

IT Security Operations Engineering Job Description
IT security risks have grown as the digital economy has grown. Part of an IT security operations engineering job description, involves the planning, updating and maintenance of the security measures, defenses, and counteractions to stop and avoid internal and external occurrences on computer systems.
As a security operations engineer, the security-service range should be followed on the day in and out.
Usually, they lead the case response work, ensuring that different occurrences are focused to completion and that the correct resources are brought into line to provide the total quality of the company's security response system.
The IT Security Operations Engineering job description includes the following important responsibilities:
To manage penetration testing of both applications and infrastructure
To perform susceptibility scans and manage the resolution of threats
To assess Software as a Service (SaaS) products for security compliance
To manage security applications, such as GDPR
To conduct periodic user access control verifications
To develop and maintain security monitoring, logging and auditing
To install required security patches and updates for a wide range of applications.
To monitor system security relating to resiliency, malware intrusion, and patching
To assess technical controls and identify areas of improvement
To serve as technical security leads for large complex projects that involve cross-functional teams
To conduct systems testing to ensure that critical vulnerabilities become identified
Educational and Certification Requirements
IT Security Operations Engineers must have a degree in Computer Science or Information Technology with an emphasis on security control. Also desirable is a certificate in the field of Security Operations. Employers are currently seeking freelance engineers with certifications such as SSCP, CISSP, CISA, CISM, CEH, and OSCP.
Skills
To become a successful IT security operations engineer, you need to have the right skills which outline the technical and general skills necessary as well as any certificates or degrees which a company might assume for an information security engineer should have. Following are the key technical skills include:
The engineer should have the capability in anti-virus software, interruption recognition, firewalls, and content filters
They should know threat assessment tools, skills, and procedures
Proficiency in planning secure networks, computer systems, and application architectures
Plan for disaster rescue, system tools, expertise and techniques
Preparation, investigating and increasing security policies, criteria, and ways
The system management, assisting several platforms and applications
Skilled with cellular code, malicious code, and anti-virus software
They should be able to maintain the log system for various kind of cyber-attacks on the organizational network.
They should use endpoint security solutions, comprising file integrity monitoring and data loss avoidance
They should facilitate the organization with the secure cloud computing platform.

The Asia Pacific and Japan (APJ) Enterprise marketing team is seeking a data-driven, hands-on and self-directed individual to drive the regional marketing strategy, plan and execution for the Telco industry. This is a unique opportunity to play a key role developing an important market segment within an exciting, fast growing business.

This role requires the ability to execute against both the strategic marketing plans and campaigns, while being creative to design new and innovative ways to reach new audiences. This role also requires strong collaboration across functions including Sales, Business Development, SME's, Global and Field Marketing to develop and execute holistic marketing campaigns.
Key job responsibilities
* Develop a regional Telco marketing strategy designed to drive awareness, acquisition and engagement within target accounts.
* Engage with sales leadership at various levels to ensure alignment on business priorities, marketing strategies, tactics and desired outcomes.
* Create and execute high-impact, online and offline, Telco specific campaigns showcasing the value and differentiation of AWS services and solutions.
* Deep dive and understand audience pain points to create insightful, action-driving content.
* Continually experiment and introduce new approaches to marketing that engage customers in innovative ways.
* Prioritise, manage and optimise marketing spend to deliver against KPIs.
* Deliver detailed reporting and metrics on activity results, campaign effectiveness, and ROI. Use data to make real-time adjustments and proactively identify trends and opportunities.
Basic qualifications
* Held a similar marketing position within the technology Industry * Minimum 8+ years work experience in or with the Telco industry * Successful track record of building and executing audience specific marketing strategies with clear goals and objectives that align with business priorities and support revenue targets. * Consistently demonstrated success in hands-on programs and campaign execution, and project management. * Ability to work on multiple, simultaneous programs that require strategic thinking as well as high-speed tactical execution. * Interested in building programs and processes from the ground up and comfortable in ambiguous environments. * Strong stakeholder engagement (internal and external) with the ability to influence.
Preferred qualifications
* Marketing experience working in rapid growth companies and industries * Knowledge about cloud computing market and technologies * Skill to use BI tools, Salesforce, Marketo and other digital marketing tools

Strategic Account Manager (also called a major account manager, key account manager, national/global account manager) is the guardian of the strategic customer relationship, orchestrating the deployment of corporate-wide resources to provide comprehensive products, services, and solutions to the strategic account.
You will be expected to manage MCI's Global Account(s) base in Singapore or in the Asia Pacific region to continue with the momentum in winning more business through strategic communication and relationship management. Do you want to work with data and analytics in the biggest sovereign wealth fund in the world Do you want to join a team that sits at the heart of the fund's core processes and pioneers the use of cloud technology and analytics to find the most efficient way of supporting our investments Then we have the job for you!

The Role
As the successful applicant you will be part of the team that operates and develops the fund's data processes and ensures the whole organisation has good quality data available for investment, trading, compliance, and risk management purposes. To find and implement new investment opportunities, the fund is always on the lookout for new data, and you will work closely with internal teams and data vendors to implement new data requirements. As a team they are continuously improving their data processes and controls and look forward to your contribution to this work through applied information technology.
Norges Bank Investment Management has a performance culture, and they believe in delegation. You will be given the opportunity to excel and to make an impact. They would like you to grow into this role and develop with the team.
The position is in Singapore and will report to the Head of Data Core. Some travel should be expected.

What you will do
This is a collaborative environment conducive to working on some of the following tasks:
Develop, support, and manage data loads into and between the fund's main systems
Ensure we as a team operate with sound data quality processes and that the fund's functions have good quality data available every day
Further develop the fund's data warehouse and other data and analytics solutions
Follow-up external data providers to ensure best-market practice and efficient processes
Contributing to the development of internal tools and models using the latest available technology including cloud-based services
Implement automation and identify process improvements for the team and across the organisation
What you need
Minimum Bachelor's degree with excellent academic records
Experience from the financial industry would be good to have but not a requirement
Passion and interest in data science and analytics
Development skills including SQL, data analytics and cloud computing tools
Who you are
International curious mindset with an eagerness to learn and ambition to excel
Analytical and creative with attention to details
Proactive and self-driven work style and a good team player
What our client offers
Their core values of excellence, innovation, integrity, and team spirit underpin their culture and how they operate across all their offices. They collaborate and share information within the organisation which consists of 37 nationalities. Their organisation is grounded in trust, high ethical standards, a flat hierarchy, and diversity. Norges Bank Investment Management is committed to ensuring Equal Opportunities for all employees.
Benefits include
Staying healthy They care about your health! That's why they offer excellent health, mental and dental benefits, including a comprehensive insurance for you and your FAMILY. You'll also be offered health assessments, counselling services and reimbursement of gym membership fees.
Spending time with FAMILY Becoming a parent Don't stress! You'll get 16 weeks, GENDER-neutral, full base pay, parental leave to spend with your child. Mothers get an additional 10 weeks of PREGNANCY related leave.
Recharge when you need to All employees get 25 vacation days, and one extra for the last week of the year
Work-life balance Our client believes that a healthy balance is crucial for your well-being. When you work here, you'll be able to combine an exciting career in the world's largest sovereign wealth fund with a fulfilling life outside the office. Of course, there are several social clubs and events within the fund too if you'd like to combine the two!
Planning for the long term They contribute 17% or 20% of base salary to your CPF or SRS. You can focus on the present and don't worry about the future.
Work with Purpose Our client work to safeguard and build financial wealth for future generations. Through responsible investment and active ownership, we help shape the future of our world.
Interested candidates may send in their resume and cover letter directly to [HIDDEN TEXT] (R1434374), stating the position as the subject title in the email.

column7:
Amazon Web Services (AWS) is a dynamic, growing business unit within Amazon.com that provides a broad set of infrastructure services including computing power, storage options, networking and databases available on demand. We are the leader in cloud computing and our pioneers are embracing innovation, building the future, and making history! Over the past years, Amazon Web Services (AWS) has been the world's most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. AWS offers over 100 fully featured services to millions of active customers around the worldincluding the fastest-growing startups, largest enterprises, and leading government agencies to power their infrastructure.

As a Procurement Compliance Manager you will work with teams across AWS, leading projects and initiatives that look to reduce business risks to AWS across a large, global portfolio of infrastructure deployments. You will work on cross-organizational projects focused on remediating identified business risks within the procurement space (i.e. processes, policies, systems). You will not stop there but will take lead in special projects that require a high level of attention and/or quick delivery time with an emphasis on operational excellence. You will be involved in expanding the functions of the team across multiple business units within AWS. Overall you will be joining a new team that focuses on governance within our Services Procurement and the larger Data Center Global Services (DCGS) organization that designs, builds, and launches data centers worldwide.

Key job responsibilities
Lead various risk remediation projects and initiatives
Manage governance related ad hoc projects
Take lead on identify and recommend necessary mechanisms to reduce business risks
Support the delivery of Governance Program goals
Take lead in establishing necessary controls, mechanisms, and policies to improve DCSP level of compliance
Drive culture of innovation, simplification and continuous improvement through best practice sharing, advocacy and hands-on leadership
Build/prioritize roadmap and drive the tactical execution of key operational excellence (OE) initiatives and resolutions across AWS Infra.
Identify new tools and business processes that simplify, standardize and enable operational excellence
Derive actionable insights and routinely present recommendations from analysis

A day in the life
There is no standard day for this position. On any given day you could start with a morning meeting speaking with customers or stakeholders in the US and finishing up with a call to EMEA. You will be working on multiple projects across multiple teams, stakeholders and customers. Your biggest customers will be our construction teams especially the cost control and construction compliance team. Stakeholders include teams such as procurement, legal, finance, EHS and more. From time to time you will interact with teams outside of AWS to share lessons learned and best practices.

About the team
You will be working on an international team with members located across the global representing 5 different cultural backgrounds. Our team is truly diverse and inclusive who is customer obsessed, thinks big, delivers results and plays hard. We are still are relatively new team with lots of opportunity to grow and expand our services/support across the broader organization.

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS
5+ years of program management experience requiring data analysis, consulting, creative problem solving, and cross-functional collaboration.
5+ years of procurement experience preferably in the CAPEX space.
3+ years of managing cross functional and cross team relationships (eg: finance, legal, construction, procurement etc.)
Demonstrated ability to negotiate and influence internal and external stakeholders to deliver results
Proven track record managing multiple projects and initiatives simultaneously from inception through completion.
3+ years of experience working on a Global team with members located in different countries and time zones.
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
8+ years experience as a program manager leading projects within the procurement, compliance, risk management, or process management domains
Experience leading multiple projects simultaneously.
Ability to operate simultaneously and effectively in both tactical and strategic modes.
Exceptional analytical, quantitative, communication, and presentation skills
Strong written and oral communication skills.
Preferred work experience in a fast paced deadline-oriented work environment
Ability to deal with ambiguous problems and build solutions with proper project management

Amazon is a committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status.

About InfoCepts
InfoCepts is a global leader of end-to-end data & analytics solutions with nearly 20 years of experience, also named as Gartner's 2020 and 2021 customers choice for Data & Analytics providers. We continue to grow rapidly year over year, now employing more than 1,000 people in offices across the globe. As we have grown, we have stayed true to our missionto always help our customers stay modern that help them make smart, data-driven decisions. Since 2004, we have deployed hundreds of high performance analytics applications over web and mobile platforms, built several advanced analytics models, processed petabytes of data using Big Data technologies and delivered several high impact business solutions. Driven by our vision of delivering great customer experiences, we are looking for professionals who are passionate about making the world a better place by leveraging the power of data.
Purpose of the Position
Based in Singapore, the role provides advisory, pre-sales, business development, and practice development support in the APAC and EMEA region for InfoCepts data and analytics practice. The position enables InfoCepts to meet its business goals by acquiring new and growing existing accounts using a portfolio of current and emerging offerings using cloud and data engineering, analytics and data management, business consulting, and service management competencies. The position is responsible for thought leadership, discovery and solutioning, proposals, advisory consulting, and capability development to include talent and expertise.
Reporting directly to a Director of Client Advisory, the position works closely with sales, marketing, delivery, and other practice teams supported by a global delivery model.
Roles and Responsibilities:
Thought Leadership Build and share experience and evidence-based thought leadership in the industry through various channels such as professional social media, blogs, white papers, webinars, events, and conferences.
Solutions and Sales Support Support pre-sales activities including engaging prospects, conducting discovery workshops, developing point of views/solutions/scoping, writing proposals, engaging partners, and supporting sales and marketing enablement.
Consulting for New and Existing Clients Provide advisory consulting to new and existing customers, anchor new solutions for key accounts, support delivery hand-offs, address unmet needs, expand relationships, manage client expectations, and maintain assigned utilization.
Support Organizational Strategy Contribute in practice development including sharing and building expertise, nurturing and growing talent, capability and offering development, and corporate initiatives as assigned.
Skills Required:
Bachelor's degree in computer science, engineering, or related field (master's degree is a plus)
Demonstrated continued learning through one or more technical certifications or related methods
Proven relevant experience in a similar capacity
Pre-sales experience in the Singapore region
Experience with delivery of data and analytic professional services
Demonstrated ability to communicate persuasively through speaking, writing, and client presentations
Expertise in one or more big data platforms and/or analytic platforms such as MicroStrategy, Tableau, Microsoft Power BI or Qlik
Experience with one or more cloud platforms to include AWS and Azure
Experience building business-oriented solutions in one or more industries such as retail, health, media, or banking and finance
Experience working with government sector will be a plus
Prior experience as a business analyst in analytics will be advantageous

column7:
Our Mission
At Palo Alto Networks everything starts and ends with our mission:
Being the cybersecurity partner of choice, protecting our digital way of life.
We have the vision of a world where each day is safer and more secure than the one before. These aren't easy goals to accomplish but we're not here for easy. We're here for better. We are a company built on the foundation of challenging and disrupting the way things are done, and we're looking for innovators who are as committed to shaping the future of cybersecurity as we are.
Disruption is at the core of our technology and on our way of work to meet the needs of our employees now and in the future through FLEXWORK, our approach to how we work. We're changing the nature of work from benefits to learning, location to leadership, we've rethought and recreated every aspect of the employee experience at Palo Alto Networks. And because it FLEXes around each individual employee based on their individual choices, employees are empowered to push boundaries and help us all evolve, together.
Job Description

Your Career
Palo Alto Networks Customer Success (CS) team partners with organizations to help guide them through their journey in protecting their businesses and driving the technical outcomes that mean the most to our customers. Our Customer Success managers and engineers are our customers advocates, product experts, and strategic advisors that help them operate and grow their businesses securely. At Palo Alto Networks, we take a proactive method to ensure customers achieve their required outcomes with a product or a service, by providing tailored guidance and support to organizations as they embark on their journey. Our customer success teams are guiding the customer during the product life cycle to increase license and feature adoption and to gain maximum value from their investment.
Our Network Security team focuses on delivering support and services across our Next Generation Firewall (NGFW), Secure Access Service Edge (SASE), and Cloud-Delivered Security Services (CDSS) technologies.
Your Career
As a Network Security Customer Success Manager, you are a critical part of our customers adoption of security integrations. You act as their day-to-day contact for products in the Network Security portfolio, establishing relationships with them in order to understand security and business priorities, provide guidance, and share operational best practices for their secure environments. You'll manage our customers services experience to ensure Palo Alto Networks is exceeding their expectations. You'll guide for quick and consistent adoption, accelerated integrations with new cloud security products, and real-time support and strategy. You have in-depth knowledge of indicators of success, leveraging data and your analytical aptitudes to guide changes, updates, and improvements.In this role, you will work closely with CISOs, security architects, security engineers, and development operations teams within mid-to-large enterprises and alongside the internal account team, confidently presenting implementation plans to all ranges of technical ability.
Your Impact
Lead client's product onboarding experience, adoption, and expansion across a range of relationships
Be the customers guide through the entire post-sales journey, and advocate in influencing product roadmap and improvements
Develop a strong partnership with and become a trusted advisor to customer stakeholders, channel partners, and executive sponsors to drive product adoption - consult them on when to consider expanding their platform, adopt new features, how to reduce time to value, upgrade software and/or hardware, and when to engage additional Palo Alto Networks services
Advise the customer on their platform adoption, their deployment of best practices using tools such as the Best Practice Assessment and partnering with Professional Services and Enablement on delivering on some of the services like security optimization and identifying training opportunities for their teams
Coach customers on how to establish and implement their Network Security change management, governance, the center of excellence programs
Identify and escalate risks and issues to the customer and Support team to achieve client success
Gain a deep understanding of typical business challenges faced by our customers in order to appropriately map features in their security environments, as well as provide proactive information, guidance, and support
Identify risks to customers subscription and service renewals on an ongoing basis and collaborate with internal teams to remediate client concerns and ensure renewal readiness
Establish relationships with customer executive sponsors, speaking on a frequent cadence to strengthen relationships while uncovering new service and product opportunities for the account team
Monitor key performance metrics like customer satisfaction, renewal rate, product upsell/cross-sell identification, reference-ability, renewal likelihood, adoption, consumption, and customer engagement - leverage these key metrics to build a strategic plan to address negative changes in the metrics
Proactively engage Customer Support and Engineering to monitor and resolve complex technical issues
Deliver Executive Business Reviews (Quarterly Services Review) with the support and involvement of the Account Team
Internal collaboration with other services teams

Your Experience
Pre-sales, account management, customer success, consulting or similar roles related to driving customer success and adoption, along with client facing sales/services experience
Experience working with Cloud platforms (Amazon Web Services, Google Cloud Platform, Azure) or in cybersecurity
Experience in or ability to work with technical support and/or professional services within the high-tech industry
Experience with a SaaS solutions company and/or an enterprise software company
Strong consulting and project management skills, with proven results working as a reliable advisor to drive business value for customers. Preferably holds Project Management or Service Delivery qualifications such as PMP, PRINCE2, and ITIL
Highly data-driven with a dedication to following the process, ability to prioritize work within a demanding environment, and consistently delivering results
Ability to identify key customer stakeholders to engage and build relationships without direct supervision
Ability to influence teams across the organization to achieve desired customer outcomes
Passionate about driving and tracking a consistent engagement process with all supported customers
Ability to multi-task and work in a dynamic environment to address emerging security risks and challenges
Excellent written and verbal communication skills as well as the ability to clearly articulate technical issues to both technical and non-technical audiences and to explain the impact in business terms
Preferred Knowledge of Networking
Knowledge of CyberSecurity Network Security is preferred
Knowledge of heterogeneous environments used by enterprise customers
Positive, growth-oriented mindset
Thrives in a matrixed, team environment anchored by our values of Collaboration, Disruption, Execution, Inclusion, and Integrity

The Team
Our Customer Success team is critical to our success and mission. As part of this team, you enable customer success by providing support to clients after they have purchased our products. Our dedication to our customers doesn't stop once they sign it evolves. As threats and technology change, we stay in step to accomplish our mission.
You'll be involved in implementing new products, transitioning from old products to new, and will fix integrations and critical issues as they are raised in fact, you'll seek them out to ensure our clients are safely supported. We fix and identify technical problems, with a pointed focus on providing the best customer support in the industry.
Our Commitment
We're trailblazers that dream big, take risks, and challenge cybersecurity's status quo. It's simple: we can't accomplish our mission without diverse teams innovating, together.
Palo Alto Networks is evolving and changing the nature of work to meet the needs of our employees now and in the future through FLEXWORK, our approach to how we work. From benefits to learning, location to leadership, we've rethought and recreated every aspect of the employee experience at Palo Alto Networks. And because it FLEXes around each individual employee based on their individual choices, employees are empowered to push boundaries and help us all evolve, together.
We are committed to providing reasonable accommodations for all qualified individuals with a disability. If you require assistance or accommodation due to a disability or special need, please contact us at [HIDDEN TEXT].
Palo Alto Networks is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity in our workplace, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or other legally protected characteristics.
Covid-19 Vaccination Information for Palo Alto Networks Jobs
Vaccine requirements and disclosure obligations vary by country. Unless applicable law requires otherwise, you must be vaccinated for COVID or qualify for a reasonable accommodation if:
The job requires accessing a company worksite
The job requires in-person customer contact and the customer has implemented such requirements
You choose to access a Palo Alto Networks worksite
If you have questions about the vaccine requirements of this particular position based on your location or job requirements, please inquire with the recruiter.

Job Description :
Job summary
DESCRIPTION
Do you like helping customers implement innovative cloud computing solutions and solve technical problems based on Microsoft Technology Stack Would you like to do this using the latest cloud computing technologies Do you have a knack for helping groups understand application architectures and integration approaches Do you have the consultative and leadership skills to help customers succeed with their cloud efforts
Amazon Web Services is looking for a Solutions Architect to help customers accelerate their adoption of the Microsoft workloads on AWS. This is an excellent opportunity to help customers understand best practices for Microsoft technologies on AWS, migrate their existing workloads, and advise them on building resilient cloud architectures. You'll also work with the AWS Service Teams to help continuously improve the Microsoft Platform on AWS. Your broad responsibilities will include: owning the technical engagement and ultimate success around specific implementation projects defining implementation architectures, responding to RFPs, developing a deep expertise in the AWS technologies as well as broad know-how around how applications and services are constructed using the AWS platform and being a subject matter expert on Microsoft technology Stack as it relates to customer end-to-end solutions and services. In addition, you will engage with other solutions architects, partner and professional services organizations do drive large and highly complex sales opportunities to closure.

Amazon Web Services (AWS) is looking for a Solutions Architect to help our customers build solutions using Microsoft development tools and technologies. This is a highly technical position for someone who can dive deep, build cloud-optimized architectures and help to develop a strategy with AWS business development teams. In this role this person will help customers with best practices for developing .NET and/or C# applications on AWS. You will get the opportunity to work directly with senior engineers and AWS service teams, help influencing their roadmaps and driving innovation.

Candidates should have a broad and deep set of skills that can be leveraged. A background in software development and previous Cloud experience on either AWS, GCP or Azure is required. Strong public speaking and writing skills are required. In this role, candidates will also have the opportunity to write white papers, deliver technical webinars, and speak at events.
Basic Qualifications :
BASIC QUALIFICATIONS
An ideal candidate will have deep expertise in the required areas and at least one other areas.
. Enterprise Architecture or complex solution architecture - Required
. Public Cloud Experience (Azure/GCP/AWS) - Required
. Windows Server & Virtualization
. Lead role in Data Center transformation / modernization and migration with Microsoft workloads - Required
. MS SQL Server Architecture ( HA/Clustering, such as AlwaysOn)
. Identity, authentication, security, privacy, and compliance including Active Directory.
. Modern Application Architecture (Queue's, Micro-Services, Containers etc)
. High level English and local language skill

Preferred Qualifications :
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
A preferred candidate will have deep expertise in at least one area
. .Net Development Skills
. Customer facing experience
. Public speaking at events
. Distributed Application Architecture (Load Balencers, SSL, Containers, Queuing technology, Caching, Web Service API's)
. Cloud and hybrid infrastructures with hybrid architecture designs
. Experience in Microsoft ELA and licensing structure
. TCO and workload optimisation
. Creating and developing unique content
. Working in a fast moving sales environment

Job Description :

As an experienced professional in Software Engineering, you'll shape the technology solutions that drive Level 3 support and development initiatives across the region, Working at the intersection of business and technology, you'll interact with colleagues in various lines of businesses to learn about challenges and opportunities, and translate that insight into high-quality solutions. In addition to working with the development team to create new solutions, you'll help optimize existing technology and identify new capabilities to ensure the applications run smoothly. While your role requires deep technological skills it also hinges on teamwork and leadership. You'll offer clear guidance and feedback to your Software Engineer colleagues, while promoting the values, culture, and brand of JPMorgan Chase & Co
Primary Responsibilities
. Lead the Level 3 team during the US hours as well as support the EMEA and APAC evening during US hours
. Drive the bug fixes and small enhancements
. Drive the audit, hygine of the appliation and production deployments
. Drive incident reviews with relevant stakeholders, ensure the action items are tracked to closure

. Manage the documentation review and approval process with the stakeholders
. Take ownership of the bug fixes and small enhancement and associated artefacts
. Build and maintain strong working relationships with the production management, project and product teams
. Provide guidance and support to team members
. Prepare and deliver training sessions to the business users and production management
Experience and Skills Required
You'll also play a crucial role in identifying, improving, and developing technology solutions that drive our strategic goals. This is a tremendous opportunity to learn about high-priority initiatives and collaborate with colleagues throughout the firm. Working at the intersection of business and technology, you'll sharpen your understanding of business processes and data analysis, while continuing to develop your leadership, management, and communication skills. No matter where your career ultimately takes you, you'll make a meaningful impact and lasting connections with outstanding colleagues and mentors.
This role requires a wide variety of strengths and capabilities, including:
. Graduate degree with minimum of 1 yearin BFSI industry. Exposure to core banking, payments is a must have skill
. Experience working on major global transformation initiatives, for example SWIFT GPI, ISO 20022, Real Time Payments etc
. Proficiency in business applications, data usage, and management
. Ability to liaison between lines of business and the development team, while working with a wide range of stakeholders and collaborating with your team
. Ability to work collaboratively in teams and develop meaningful relationships to achieve common goals
. Experience obtaining requirements from business users and subject matter experts, reviewing business priorities, and/or analyzing options & risks
. Ability to code in Java, Oracle, Microservices based architecture with experience in distributed cache and cloud computing
. Experience in articualting functional system requirements specifications
. Should be Detail-oriented, strong analytical and communication skills are a must
. Ability to synthe large amounts of information, and a curiosity to ask appropriate questions to fully develop business and functional requirements.
. Pro-actively lead/participate in design/solution architecting of target state
. Ability to interface directly with Senior Business Stakeholders and users with a view to influence and drive consensus.
. Create detailed features, stories and keeping the documentation up-to-date
. Participate in creation of detailed functional specifications with AS-IS process flows and target state processes
. Provide techincal support throughout the project lifecycle, from requirements/functional specs to reviewing SIT and UAT test cases, and supporting all the testing phases.
. Knowledge of software development life cycle in agile methodology

column7:
DESCRIPTION

This role will work directly with AWS partners and financial institutions in adapting their control frameworks to successfully move their IT to the AWS cloud.

Amazon Web Services (AWS) is rapidly expanding its presence in the enterprise arena with a focus on financial services. AWS offers global public cloud offerings with a diversity of compliance programs and attestations to enable AWS customer base. AWS is looking for independent, passionate, and deeply experienced professionals in the global financial services compliance and governance arena to provide thought leadership in assisting financial institutions to move regulated workloads and data into the cloud by addressing their specific security, regulatory, compliance and governance requirements. This candidate should be an experienced and innovative security/compliance/governance professional who has the ability to handle a wide range of compliance requirements and can translate those requirements into applications for cloud computing. The Compliance Specialist will work directly with AWS partners and financial institutions in adapting their control frameworks to successfully move their IT to the AWS cloud.

This key position requires specialized experience supporting financial services sector compliance efforts and will have high visibility at the most senior levels of government agencies, institutions, and AWS including frequent interaction with CISOs, CTOs, CCOs, CROs, their staffs, and AWS senior leadership. The position, as part of the AWS Worldwide Financial Services team, will act as the primary Governance/Compliance interface for Financial Services institutions. The candidate will already have, and continue to foster, key relationships, and be able to interpret the impacts of policy changes, and track and report on industry trends.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:
. Participate in financial services regulatory compliance assessments and relevant control discussions with AWS teams. This includes synthesizing control requirements, and recommending and pursuing alternative approaches assisting customers in developing compliance roadmaps
. Develop industry leading compliance related, customer-facing resources based on projected customer needs and current demand
. Assist the AWS Security Assurance team in determining the strategic direction of the various AWS compliance programs based on customer interaction and demonstrative metrics
. Be and remain connected with industry trends and events. Develop and maintain relationships with key leaders in governance, risk, and compliance at Financial Services institutions
. Collaborate with service teams on industry specific requirements that impact components of AWS services
. Assist the work of Financial Services institutions internal and external auditors or advisors as needed
. Keep the AWS Worldwide Financial Services leadership team fully informed of customer engagement status, issues, and activities.

A day in the life

About the hiring group

Job responsibilities

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

. Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems Management, or other related business fields
. Progressive experience in Financial Services compliance, legal, or governance
. Personal, hands-on experience in developing compliance/regulatory documentation
. Experience in working directly with senior corporate/government officials and/or auditors
. Strong verbal and written communication skills are a must
. Must have a demonstrated ability to work effectively across internal and external organizations
. Proficiency in MS Word, Excel, and PowerPoint

Travel may be required for this role, up to 50%.

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

. Familiarity with technical assessments and audit methodologies for technical systems (network, operating systems, application security) as well as IT auditing processes
. Familiarity with cloud computing services/deployment architecture
. Demonstration of innovative compliance approaches in non-traditional IT environments (cloud)
. Experience and proficiency in public speaking
. Deep understanding of relevant regulatory guidance Federal Risk and Authorization Management Program (FedRAMP), National Institute for Science and Technology (NIST) guidelines, Federal Information Processing Standards (FIPS), FCA guidance FG16/5 (Guidance for firms outsourcing to the cloud and other third party IT services), EBA Recommendations on Outsourcing to Cloud Providers, C5 requirements of the Federal Office of Information Security of Germany and other applicable standards and requirements
. Experience in building successful compliance programs
. Experience defining compliance roadmaps based on customer requirements, compliance documentation, and ensuring that committed assessments are delivered on schedule
. Have a record of delivery of onboarding compliance financial services workloads
. Intermediate or better level of knowledge of certification requirements of an Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS) under the aforementioned compliance programs
. Ability to think critically and be responsive to time sensitive requests

Job Description :
Job summary
Amazon Web Services (AWS) is a global leader in cloud computing, offering services from data centers globally. AWS is a high-growth, fast-moving group within Amazon with a start-up mentality where new and diverse challenges arise every day as it seeks to lower costs, become more agile, and innovate faster for our customers.

We are seeking a Senior Accountant to support our core accounting responsibilities for AWS in the Asia Pacific (APAC) region. This role will support the accounting and financial reporting for our AWS APAC entities under US GAAP. This role will partner across the AWS organization to support our geographic expansion and service and infrastructure launches in the APAC region.

If you are a financial accounting professional who consistently exceeds expectations, who dares to make bold decisions, and whose ears perk up at the prospect of a challenge, then Amazon is a place where your career can flourish.

Key job responsibilities
. Support various aspects of accounting and reporting process.
. End-to-end process ownership to support finance and business partners.
. Understand internal control design concepts sufficient to assess the effectiveness of controls and design new processes and controls for emerging and growing business activities.
. Execute judgment to keep projects moving and ensure the right decisions are reached to close the books each month.
. Escalate risks and issues as necessary to leadership.
. Strong sense of ownership.
. Ability to identify process improvement and automation opportunities to drive positive change across the organization.
. Lead delivery of accounting tasks and projects.
. Enhance partnerships between Accounting and various business and IT groups.
. Research, conclude and memorialize technical accounting position papers.
Basic Qualifications :
. 5+ years of finance experience or a related analytical field.
. Degree in accounting or related field
Preferred Qualifications :
. CPA (or equivalent)
. Accounting management experience with Big Four (public) or Fortune 500/multi-national clients.
. Operational accounting experience with one or more Fortune 500/multi-national companies for two or more years.
. Working knowledge of the COSO internal control framework and a solid understanding of the concepts of control design and operational efficiency.
. Familiarity with GAAP research tools and the FASB codification.
. Experience working with a fast-paced, high-tech start-up or complex company.
. Experience with researching and documenting support for accounting conclusions.
. Demonstrated history of solving multiple complex operational and accounting challenges.
. Aptitude for team leadership - influencing and galvanizing others to follow you toward a solution.
. Natural propensity for organization and an aptitude for information technology.
. Strong interpersonal, written and oral communication skills.
. Excellent analytical skills.

Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer, and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or other legally protected status.

(3 months contract to perm, trainings provided!)
This role is a unique opportunity to work in some of the most cutting edge data centers in the world. Amazon data centers are large-scale high-density centers where you will be working on changing the face of Cloud technology in the region. You will be assigned as a trainee where you will have exposure to learn and understand how our Data center works, interact with our support teams and customers. Experience the latest technologies of our cloud that puts you among top talents of data center technical support teams. You will spend 3 months on the trainee program, and by the end of it, your progression will be evaluated to see if you have what it takes to join our successful team and be a full time Amazonian.
This is a opportunity where the candidate will work with local and/or global Data center teams as needed. As a Data Center Technician Intern, he or she will be working with Site stationed DCO, DCEO, Logistics and Security team to support small and Large scale projects and support activities like DC Audits (Rack, Server, parts etc), cycle counts etc. He/She also will be working on Software development projects for SIN Infra teams.
Responsibilities
There is never a dull moment as each day presents itself with different challenges. Some of the key responsibilities you will be trained on are:
Perform Data center Servers and Network systems installation and configurations
Perform hardware diagnostics and troubleshoot all Systems hardware and Network related problems
Perform intermediate level Linux OS troubleshooting
Perform intermediate level Network configuration troubleshooting
Perform replacement of internal and external hardware parts of Servers and Network devices
Perform storage media (HDD, SSD etc.) sanitization and destruction tasks
Maintain a high level of system reliability by prioritizing resolution of trouble tickets efficiently
Work with multiple internal teams (DC operations, DC Engineering, Logistics, Security, Projects etc.) and be a good team player
Work with external/3rd party vendors and contractors to achieve organization needs
Adhere to DC operations, Logistics, Security and Safety related processes and guidelines
Practice and enforce Amazons Security and Safety best practices
Share ideas and contribute in projects to improve DC work environment and to improve DC operational efficienciesParticipate, lead and deliver small to mid-scale projects including Data Center rollout
Understands operational metrics and drive actions to achieve the targets
Basic qualifications
Diploma Holders in Electrical & Electronics, Computer & Communications Engineering, Information & Digital Technologies with good grades
Technical education (eg ITE) with relevant working experience Passionate about IT infrastructure and hardware
Basic knowledge of System hardware and Network devices
Have basic understanding of IT Systems and/or Network concepts and having troubleshooting experience is a plus
Knowledge of programming language i.e. Python, Perl, Shell Scripting is a plus but not a must
Good written & verbal communication and team player skills
Basic knowledge of Data centers and Cloud computing technologies and services

column7:
Our Company
For more than a century, our Company has been inventing for life, bringing forward medicines and vaccines for many of the world's most challenging diseases. Today, it continues to be at the forefront of research to deliver innovative health solutions and advance the prevention and treatment of diseases that threaten people and animals around the world.
Our Singapore IT Hub
Established in 2015, our Singapore IT Hub aims to harness digital solutions for better business outcomes. One of its key focuses is in using analytics and data science to guide better ecision-making.
Home to more than 300 employees with over 20 nationalities, the Singapore IT Hub is part of a global network, with sister hubs located in the United States and Czech Republic. In Singapore, the hub houses a wide span of IT capabilities teams ranging from Data Science, Software Engineering, Cybersecurity & Risk Management to Enterprise Platforms and many more. Across Japan, China and the Asia Pacific region, the hub works closely with colleagues from all divisions of the company to drive our core business.
This position is part of the Company Led Training (CLT) programme which is a structured development programme jointly developed by the our Singapore IT Hub and the Infocomm Media Development Authority (IMDA) that aims to enable fresh and mid-level professionals to acquire specialist expertise for jobs in demand by the industry, especially those that support Smart Nation projects. More details (https://www.imda.gov.sg/imtalent/programmes/clt )
As a Cloud Specialist, you will be tasked to continue the growth, evolution, and scalability of our existing cloud technology. You will demonstrate technical depth, strong interpersonal skills and a passion to solve complex business problems.
As part of our Cloud Services team you will work in a dynamic environment across several departments or teams applying your expertise and knowledge to solve problems faced by our cloud users. You will need to work in an Agile way and exhibit a mindset of a Product Owner to collaborate effectively with application developers, data science analysts, architects, infrastructure engineers, and cloud providers in troubleshooting and development of cloud solutions needed to meet company's business requirements.
Your activities and responsibilities are the following
Provide 1st line technical support to our cloud users
Manage access to cloud computing services to ensure compliance to security and company policies
Develop and implement automation solutions to reduce or eliminate recurring operational tasks
Assist cloud architect/engineers in design and implementation of secure cloud architectures
Conduct POC on the latest cloud technology that contribute to future state capabilities
Participate in Daily Scrum as a Developer or as facilitator of the meeting
Participate in building a Product Catalog that is align to the business requirements
Manage updates and revisions of operational manuals
Host learning programs to educate users on cloud technology best practices
Requirements
BS in Information Technology, Computer Science or Engineering or equivalent experience.
Between 0 - 3 years of working experience in relevant area
Excellent analytical and communication skills are essential for this role, as well as passion for problem solving, a desire to learn, and the ability to work in a team environment
Who we are
Merck & Co., Inc., Kenilworth, New Jersey, USA is known as Merck in the United States, Canada & Puerto Rico. We are known as MSD in Europe, Middle East, Africa, Latin America & Asia Pacific. We are a global biopharmaceutical leader with a diverse portfolio of prescription medicines, oncology, vaccines and animal health products.
We are driven by our purpose to develop and deliver innovative products that save and improve lives. With 69,000 employees operating in more than 140 countries, we offer state of the art laboratories, plants and offices that are designed to Inspire our employees as we learn, develop and grow in our careers. We are proud of our 125 years of service to humanity and continue to be one of the world's biggest investors in Research & Development.
What we look for
In a world of rapid innovation, we seek brave Inventors who want to make an Impact in all aspects of our business, enabling breakthroughs that will affect generations to come. We encourage you to bring your disruptive thinking, collaborative spirit and diverse perspective to our organization. Together we will continue Inventing For Life, Impacting Lives while Inspiring Your Career Growth.
We are proud to be a company that embraces the value of bringing diverse, talented, and committed people together. The fastest way to breakthrough innovation is when diverse ideas come together in an inclusive environment. We encourage our colleagues to respectfully challenge one another's thinking and approach problems collectively for the common good. We are an equal opportunity employer, committed to fostering an inclusive and diverse workplace.
*NOTE: Only shortlisted candidates will be notified. This role is supported under IMDA's TeSA Company-Led Training Programme (CLT). By applying to the job posting, it is deemed that the applicant agrees to share their data with IMDA for the purpose of programme administration and verification purpose. Job applicants must be Singaporeans.
Please submit your application together with your resume directly via link - https://msd.wd5.myworkdayjobs.com/SearchJobs/job/SGP---Singapore---MYP-Centre-WeWork/Cloud-Specialist-IMDA-CLT_R141304
#TeSA #CLT
